comment: Very nice lady, but totally clueless. She shouldn't be a teacher though. She will do what she can to make you pass. Gives a lot of extra credit. I should have failed this course (my average was in the 50's) but I did a lot of EC & met with her outside of class & got a C. Make your own study guides from the book, tests are VERY HARD.

She is a doll! it was her first year so she didnt know. But she will try everything to give you a good grade. I was behind in chem lab..like 3 or 4 chapers and i ended up making a C in chem lab, but I made a B in her class. I thought she was wonderful!

Very sweet lady, howeve first semester teaching at Kennesaw, was still finding her way, got better as the semester progressed. Very helpful to the students, but need to ask. Tried very hard to make sure the students got best grade possible, dropped lowest 2 quiz scores, lowest test score. Adjusted grading policy from beginning of semester to do so.

Like stated, very sweet lady. However, her tests are unfair. Its so much broader than what she teaches. She does give a lot of extra credit and will throw in a curve sometimes. If you cant get someone else, i would try.

Sweet lady,but she shouldn't be a teacher.Clueless, disorganized & doesn't respond to emails.You are always going to be 3-4 chapters behind other chem classes.Be prepared to teach yourself.Just gave a test with a study guide, only 2 ?'s were from study guide & what she told us not to worry about were the 1st 8 ?'s.She's exhausting&frustrating.AVOID
Had her for lab. SWEETEST lady hands down. Willing to help and is very understanding to your other busy schedules. Attendance is manditory, but it is for every lab. Take her

Very very sweet lady, BUT AVOID TAKING HER CLASS. I try, I study, and I read and it still doesn't seem to work. She is very unclear and she teaches things that she isn't sure of, and a lot of the time she is very wrong. She is messy and disorganized and I'm waiting for missing grades to show up. Students correct her on her notes, not a good sign.

Sweet lady, not meant to be a teacher though. Organic Chemistry is hard enough as it is, and she makes it difficult to understand. She means well but confuses herself and gets caught up and is easy to misunderstand. Sit in the front and PAY ATTENTION. Use the book to help you, you're going to need it. Be prepared to devote your life to this class.

Very nice teacher. This is her first year teaching as she used to be a chemist. Unfortunately, there were a lot of whiners in class and people who didn't read the book and wanted their hand held the whole class, which slowed the class way down for the rest of us. Read the book, do the homework, and come to class it's an easy A.
I really like her as a teacher. She is really nice and tries her best to make sure you understand the material. I recommend taking her if you can!
